body_html:
I would take a look at the Makefile where we deal with iOS builds:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile#L288

You'll see there are already two platforms, 'real' devices and the simulator. I expect you'll need to add a third option for WatchOS, something like:

	WATCHOS_PLATFORM := $(shell xcrun --sdk watchos --show-sdk-platform-path)
	WATCHOS_SYSROOT := $(shell xcrun --sdk watchos --show-sdk-path)

Then I'm not sure if you'll need a new architecture or not, but you'll have to add some section or conditional where you set compiler and linker flags like -mwatchos-version-min I think, like we do for -miphoneos-version-min.

body:
I would take a look at the Makefile where we deal with iOS builds:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile#L288

You'll see there are already two platforms, 'real' devices and the simulator. I expect you'll need to add a third option for WatchOS, something like:

```
	WATCHOS_PLATFORM := $(shell xcrun --sdk watchos --show-sdk-platform-path)
	WATCHOS_SYSROOT := $(shell xcrun --sdk watchos --show-sdk-path)
```
Then I'm not sure if you'll need a new architecture or not, but you'll have to add some section or conditional where you set compiler and linker flags like `-mwatchos-version-min` I think, like we do for `-miphoneos-version-min`.
